Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC = 25 μM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538p (MIC = 25 μM), Staphylococcus epidermis ATCC 12228 (MIC = 100 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC = 25 μM), Shigella dysentariae ATCC 9752 (MIC = 100 μM), Salmonella typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC > 100 μM), Klebsiella pneumonia ATCC 10031 (MIC = 50 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC = 100 μM).
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: As expected, in the far ultraviolet circular dichroism (CD) experiment, the stapled heptapeptides displayed enhanced helical contents compared to their corresponding unstapled counterparts.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: De Novo Design and Their Antimicrobial Activity of Stapled Amphipathic Helices of Heptapeptides
Literature.Author: Thuy T.T. Dinh, Do-Hee Kim, Song-Jin Lee, Young-Woo Kim

Literature.Title: Mono-substitution effects on antimicrobial activity of stapled heptapeptides
Literature.Author: Luong HX, Kim DH, Mai nT, Lee BJ, Kim YW
